intro: Spergularia exilis, commonly known as slender sandspurry, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Its succulent stems and leaves help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Spergularia exilis is also known for its ability to tolerate salt and is sometimes used in restoration projects for stabilizing coastal or desert soils.
